text: Pleomele auwahiensis, commonly known as Maui hala pepe, is a species of flowering plant that is endemic to the islands of Maui and Molokai in Hawaii. It can be found in dry and mesic forests at elevations of . It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== * World Conservation Monitoring Centre 1998. Pleomele auwahiensis. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 23 August 2007. title: Pleomele auwahiensis
